00024 #define NO_INPUT

00027 const std::size_t NUMRANDOMS = 2;
00028 #endif
00029 #ifdef OPAC2
00030 const std::size_t NUMRANDOMS = 4;
00031 #endif
00032 #ifdef OPAC3

00061 void GetInput( std::string& resume, std::string& inputFile, std::string& outputFile, 
00062   long& NumberOfIterations );
00063 
00064 int main(int argc, char *argv[])
00065 {
00066   // Sample program doing a Monte Carlo calculation
00067   // We need to choose the dimensionality of the Monte Carlo at COMPILE time
00068   // This is in the NUMRANDOMS macros above
00069   // Note that the calculation engine (eg GLV) may use more than one random number
00070   // per eg order in opacity, so NUMRANDOMS is a multiple of opacity
00071 
00072   std::cout << std::endl;
00073   std::cout << "Monte Carlo: Opacity version 3 by Simon Wicks" << std::endl;
00074   std::cout << "(using " << NUMRANDOMS << " random numbers)." << std::endl << std::endl;
00075 
00076   // The only input needed from the user is:
00077   // 1) whether we are resuming from a previous run,
00078   // 2) the filename of the parameters (+data if resuming) to read in
00079   // 3) the filename to which to write our results
00080   // 4) the number of iterations to do
00081   long NumberOfIterations;
00082   std::string resume = ""; std::string inputFile = ""; std::string outputFile = "";
00083   GetInput( resume, inputFile, outputFile, NumberOfIterations );
00084 
00085   // The templatized nature of the Driver means that a number of different calculations
00086   // can be done just by changing the code here in main.
00087   // A number of examples are given below
00088   // Just get rid of the /* */ around the block
00089 
00090   /*
00091   // Glv calculation using most of the old code ('version 1'), but using a wrapper
00092   // to put it into the new templatized Driver
00093   // GlvCalcer only really does a dq dphi_q integration and throws away an extra
00094   // random number per dimension, hence it uses 3 random number per order in opacity
00095   // ie opacity = NUMRANDOMS/3
00096   // TODO: change this to work again
00097   //Driver<RadCalcerWrapper<9>, Store2D, 9> myDriver;
00098   */
00099 
00100   /*
00101   // Glv calculation, using the new ('version 3') calculation code (GlvRadiative3),
00102   // but using a wrapper around the old ('version 1') QperpCalculator code (QperpCalculator1)
00103   // (which is slower than the newer version, but is a good test to give the same answer)
00104   // GlvRadiative3 does a dq dphi_q integration, hence opacity = NUMRANDOMS/2
00105   Driver<GlvRadiative3
00106     <QperpGenerator3<NUMRANDOMS/2>, QperpCalculator1<NUMRANDOMS/2>, NUMRANDOMS>, 
00107     Store2D, NUMRANDOMS> myDriver;
00108   */
00109   
00110   // Glv calculation using the new calculation code (GlvRadiative3) and the
00111   // new qperpcalculator code (QperpCalculator3)
00112   // GlvRadiative3 does a dq dphi_q integration, hence opacity = NUMRANDOMS/2
00113   Driver<GlvRadiative3
00114     <QperpGenerator3<NUMRANDOMS/2>, QperpCalculator3<NUMRANDOMS/2>, NUMRANDOMS>, 
00115     Store2D, NUMRANDOMS> myDriver;
00116 
00117   /*
00118   // TODO: write a GlvRadiative4 which includes the z integration
00119   */
00120 
00121 
00122   // End of different calculation examples
00123 
00124   // Call the driver to set up itself and all the other objects
00125   // If ok, it'll return 0. If not, then it'll return something else.
00126   int errCode = myDriver.Setup( resume, inputFile );
00127   if ( errCode != 0 )
00128   {
00129     std::cerr << "Error on setting up, code = " << errCode << std::endl;
00130     return EXIT_SUCCESS;
00131   }
00132 
00133   // Everything is ready in the calculation, just set up the final
00134   // bits for the user interface: timer and progress bar
00135   // ProgressBar: The first number of the current point (start = 0),
00136   // the second is the end point, the total number
00137   Timer timer;
00138   ProgressBar progBar(0,NumberOfIterations);
00139   progBar.PrintPreliminaries();
00140   
00141   // And now we run the main loop
00142   timer.StartTimer();
00143   for (long i=0; i<NumberOfIterations; ++i)
00144   {
00145     progBar.SetNow(i);
00146     progBar.PrintProgress();
00147     myDriver.RunOneIteration();
00148   }
00149   progBar.SetNow(NumberOfIterations);
00150   progBar.PrintProgress();
00151   timer.StopTimer();
00152   // And the main loop is done!
00153 
00154   // Tell the driver to save our results to file
00155   myDriver.SaveResults( outputFile );
00156  
00157   // Print to screen a few details of the run
00158   progBar.PrintFinal();
00159   double totTime = timer.GetResult();
00160   std::cout << "Total time = " << totTime << " seconds\n";
00161   std::cout << "Time per iteration = " << totTime/static_cast<double>(NumberOfIterations);
00162   std::cout << "\n";
00163   std::cout << std::endl;
00164 
00165   return EXIT_SUCCESS;
00166 }
00167 
00168 void GetInput( std::string& resume, std::string& inputFile, std::string& outputFile, 
00169   long& NumberOfIterations)
00170 {
00171   // Get required input for the Monte Carlo run
00172   // First, ask whether we are resuming the Monte Carlo statistics from a previous run
00173   do
00174   {
00175     std::cout << "Resume from a previous run? (y/n) ";
00176 #ifdef NO_INPUT
00177    resume = "n";
00178    std::cout << resume;
00179 #else
00180     std::cin >> resume;
00181 #endif
00182     std::cout << "\n";
00183   } 
00184   while ( !( resume=="y" || resume=="n" ) );
00185   
00186   // Second, filenames
00187   std::cout << "\nEnter input file and output file\n";
00188   std::cout << "(no spaces in file names, separate two names with a space): ";
00189 #ifdef NO_INPUT
00190   inputFile = "./results/temp.params"; outputFile = "./results/temp.txt";
00191   std::cout << std::endl << inputFile << " " << outputFile;
00192 #else
00193   std::cin >> inputFile >> outputFile;
00194 #endif
00195   std::cout << "\n";
00196   
00197   // Finally (thirdly), how many Monte Carlo iterations do we want?
00198   std::cout << "How many Monte Carlo iterations? ";
00199 #ifdef NO_INPUT
00200   NumberOfIterations = 100000;
00201   std::cout << NumberOfIterations;
00202 #else
00203   std::cin >> NumberOfIterations;
00204 #endif
00205   std::cout << std::endl << std::endl;
00206 }
